sourceDesc.p: Generated from the TLS textfiles as exported on 2020-02-21. First source reported:SHANGBO.LISONG 8.50.1 (STRIP 1A) MACHENGYUAN 8: 231 TR. MARCO CABOARA
Translation of 楚竹書・李頌(en) into English.

p.seg: look at the bushes
they go together (live) with the tung tree.
neat outside (?) scattered at the centre (?)
the rule (king) of the bushes (?)
? urged (?) by winter's bitter cold
its leaves will fall
the (place of) congregation of the peng birds (?)
wait for (the right) time and then rise (again).
that tree grows alone
among the thorns of the hazels.
urgently planted (upright?) and fast accomplished (??)
its thickness (?) will not return (?)
thick, sharp, spread out and intertwined (?)
lofty in its integrity (?)
?? the messy (?) roots and the thick branches (of the other trees)
(threaten to) destroy (it) ??
alas, gentleman!
look at the tree's appearance!
it doesn't grow (up) together (with the other trees)
it is they are not similar (to them)!
(so one can say that) the masses of common birds [unlike the Peng birds],
reverently will not congregate (on its top) (?).
the white flowers (?) strive (?) for principles (?). plain residences and palaces ??
the different kind of trees (?)
one yearns for the starting time of the year (?)
think about the excellence of the trees.
prosperous, magnificent, important and glorious
what the people cherishes.
guards the objects and strengthen the stem (?)
the heart-mind of the tree is unified (?)
opposed to the other trees
not bowing to the wind (like them)
